comment.author: 19973250@N00
comment._content: www.history.navy.mil/photos/sh-usn/usnsh-c/ah3.htm has a lot of information on a USN Comfort, but it was rebuilt from a different ship called the Havana. The Saratoga pictured above, and the one on the Navy site look like the same ship, including the same riggings. According to the US Navy websites, the Saratoga was converted to USN Mercy. Here is the site: www.history.navy.mil/photos/sh-usn/usnsh-m/ah4.htm with more pictures.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: Yes, agreed.  S.S. Saratoga was built in 1907 and purchased by Navy in 1917, commissioned hospital ship USS Mercy in 1918.

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information. We'll add it to the source data and reload the description.
